description: A heavily fortified Marine military base located in Paradise. The Straw Hats accidentally crash-land in the middle of this base after their descent from Skypiea. It is commanded by Vice Admiral Jonathan and features a lake where the Going Merry lands.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Crash Land at Marine Base G-8
keyEvents.description: The Going Merry crashes down from Skypiea and lands directly in the middle of Marine Base G-8, immediately putting the crew in danger as sirens blare and spotlights illuminate their ship.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the G-8 Arc and creates immediate peril for the Straw Hats, who must escape from a heavily fortified Marine installation.

statusHistory.reason: Marine base is fully operational when the Straw Hats arrive

description: The edge of Skypiea where the White Sea ends and provides a route for descending back to the Blue Sea. The Straw Hats use this location to depart from Skypiea with the help of Conis and Pagaya.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Depart via Cloud End
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats reach Cloud End with Conis and Pagaya's guidance and begin their descent from Skypiea back to the Blue Sea.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the crew's departure point from Skypiea and the end of the Sky Island Saga.

statusHistory.reason: Natural location that serves as exit point from Skypiea

description: The Sky Island where the Straw Hats had their adventures. In this episode, the island achieves peace as Gan Fall resumes leadership and unifies the Sky People and Shandians.

keyEvents.title: Gan Fall Becomes God of Unified Skypiea
keyEvents.description: The Shandia Chief asks Gan Fall to lead Skypiea once more, and he accepts, unifying the Sky People and Shandians under his leadership.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the peaceful resolution of the 400-year conflict and establishes a new era for Skypiea.

keyEvents.title: Golden Bell Rings in Farewell
keyEvents.description: The people of Skypiea ring the Golden Bell as the Straw Hats descend, expressing gratitude and welcoming them to return anytime.
keyEvents.significance: A heartfelt farewell that shows the deep gratitude of the Skypieans and Shandians toward the Straw Hats.

statusHistory.reason: Peace achieved between Sky People and Shandians under Gan Fall's leadership

description: The island in the Blue Sea where Montblanc Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance reside. In this episode, Cricket hears the Golden Bell ringing from the sky, confirming his ancestor's story.

keyEvents.title: Cricket Hears Golden Bell from Jaya
keyEvents.description: While on Jaya, Cricket, Masira, and Shoujou hear the Golden Bell ringing from the sky, confirming that the City of Gold exists in the heavens.
keyEvents.significance: Provides emotional payoff and vindication for Cricket's lifelong search, proving his ancestor Noland's claims were true.
